intro: Rytigynia liberica, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, which is used to make coffee. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in its native range.
